data.title: area code
data.meta_description: AREA CODE meaning: 1. a series of numbers used before the main phone number when you phone someone outside your own…. Learn more.

Examples of area code

area code

You know, prohibit the phone from dialing or receiving calls between now 11am day-after-tomorrow for a specific person, number or area code.

The system meant that those early computers would be able to distinguish between a long-distance area code and a local number.

Next you'll choose a number based on the area code you prefer.

He gives me a number in an area code a thousand miles north of his own.

Damaged telephone infrastructure meant that calls through the 504 area code were often not as effective as text-messages.

You could liken an area code, now, to a sports team affiliation.

The weather announcements for the 410 area code seem to come from a different stable of forecasters.

Anyone with a modem and a home computer could dial-in, often for free, and interact with other callers in their area code.

Finally, the fact that you received a phone call from your local area code does not mean that the call is not actually originating from overseas.

Splits and overlays of area codes, especially as the population of phone users grew in the 1980s and 1990s, became common.

The area codes that lead our own phone numbers today -- 212, 202, 415 -- were direct results of their work.

Area codes, of course, weren't always simply symbolic.

There were, given the possible permutations of the rotary dial, 152 potential area codes.

He digs around through a file of old schematics and comes up with about a dozen numbers in three widely separated area codes.

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.
